content: The "Services for Children of Substance Abusers Reauthorization Act" may be cited as the short title. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act are included in the Act. The "Services for Children of Substance Abusers Reauthorization Act" amends the Public Health Service Act by changing the administration and activities related to the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration. The "Services for Children of Substance Abusers Reauthorization Act" expands services for children through various providers including family social services, child protective services, child care providers, community-based centers, criminal justice system, health and mental health providers, and education and training for health. The "Services for Children of Substance Abusers Reauthorization Act" aims to expand services for children by providing education and training to health care professionals, child welfare providers, and personnel serving children and families. It also includes the identification of certain children under the Public Health Service Act.
